summary: This is an automatic out-of-office email reply from a U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) public affairs contact, sent in response to an inquiry about Jeffrey Epstein and Bourget Airport from a journalist in France. It indicates media interest in Epstein's travel connections shortly after his death.

events.title: Journalist inquiry about Epstein and Bourget Airport
events.description: A journalist in France contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Bourget Airport, triggering an automatic out-of-office reply.

keyFacts: On September 29, 2019, a journalist in France contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Bourget Airport.
The email is an automatic out-of-office reply, indicating the public affairs contact was unavailable at the time.
The inquiry shows international media interest in Epstein's travel patterns and connections following his death in August 2019.
Bourget Airport is a private airport in France, relevant to investigations into Epstein's international travel.
The document demonstrates ongoing public and media scrutiny of the Epstein case in late 2019.
